fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39313].
  {panel}

In Confluence our users doesn't have an option to remove the profile picture, or a function to return to the default one(_when you don't have a profile picture_).

Our customer asked some instructions of how to remove the profile picture since it doesn't have anything in the User Interface. The only way that we found was through the database by removing an row from the *os_propertyentry* table and a script created by another customer in the [Atlassian Answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/19144203].

Confluence should have a "Delete" button as the *5.1.5* version has.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Go to your Profile page.
# Upload an image.
# Try to delete without uploading a new one.
fields.summary: Option to remove the profile picture or a Delete button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39310].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Cannot use Confluence Mobile Menu by Safari in iOS9, which has just been released officially. It shows Confluence Mobile Menu itself, but users cannot tap each items in the menu.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect to Confluence Cloud and Server instance by Safari in iOS9
# Try to login via Confluence Mobile Menu

h3. Expected Results
Login page is shown when user tap 'login' in Confluence Mobile Menu

h3. Actual Results
No response even when user tap 'login' in Confluence Mobile Menu
fields.summary: Cannot use Confluence Mobile Menu by Safari in iOS9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39308].
  {panel}

I tried to ask this question on the community board and received a question in response, but since this is the first time I've participated in that board, I can only post a response every 24 hours until I've posted 3 times, so I'm going to try this way. Please help. This is important to us.


*Original Question:*

We are using Atlassian Confluence 5.8.8.
I have been using the Include Page Macro a lot and it's essential to our documentation model.
Now we have started using multiple spaces and it is not working for me.
I created a New Space and created several documents within that space. On my master document page, I tried to use include page macro and it only finds pages from our original space, not New Space.
It does not see any pages from the New Space. 
Other macros I've tried to use seem to work. Just not that one. I created another space and the same thing happens there.
What I've tried:
•	I have played around with titles of the pages, permissions, different pages, etc.  
•	I've tried using the space key/space/colon for the New Space. That didn't work.
•	I tried a work-around I read about to insert a page I could access and edit it. That didn't work.
Thank you for any suggestions to solve this problem. It's huge for us.
________________________________________
*Nic's  answer:*

To use pages from other spaces, you have to specify the target page's space key.
E.g. for a page called "Stuff to include" in a space keyed with NIC, you need to tell the macro NIC:Stuff to Include
Note that the space key is case sensitive.
If that is not working, then can you describe what happens when you save a macro with such a macro embedded in it?

________________________________________
*The response I want to give him:*

I am trying to use the macro include a page that is in the same space as the master document (New Space) and it's only finding pages in another space (Original Space).  
So one of the troubleshooting things I tried in desperation was treating the current space (New Space) like it was another space. It was just a shot it the dark.  

Everything works great in the Original Space. We create original documents and include pages in them all they time. The content appears in the master document seamlessly. We love the way it works. I just need it to also work within New Space.

Thank you for any help you can give me.
fields.summary: Include Macro not working within its own space-pulling from another space
Ability to customize the Summary sent on Confluence emails

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39299].
  {panel}

Hello

many of our 100 Users asks to display on the Confluence Welcome Page a list of their own recently updated items, so that they can work fast and so they don't have to search for their own items.

Therefore, it would be great if the recently updated macro could filter for the currently logged in user - and just display his own items.

Thanks a lot in advance,
kind regards,
Thomas 
Schittli
fields.summary: Please allow 'recently updated' macro to display only items of current logged in user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39283].
  {panel}

Currently when pressing the 'e' shortcut to edit a page, the page is opened in editing mode. However, the page is always opened at the top, independently from the part of the page you were viewing before (in viewing mode). For large pages this is very cumbersome, since you have to scroll all the way down in the editing view when you were viewing the end of the page before. Moreover, if there are a lot of macros on the page, the similarity between edit mode and viewing mode is often quite low, which only makes the searching to the right spot in the editing view even more time consuming.

I suggest following improvement:
* When pressing 'e': in the editing mode jump directly to the text line which was displayed at the top of the browser screen in the viewing mode.
* If the "double-click to edit" functionality is provided: jump to the line where the double-click occured.
fields.summary: Edit improvement: Directing to correct page location

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39282].
  {panel}

Inline comments needs some improvements with respect to traceability of comments over Confluence page versions. Currently it is not possible to trace:
* In which page version each comment was added.
* [In which page versions each comment was present (after adding, until being resolved).]
* In what page version each comment has been resolved.
* Overview of unresolved comments

I request following improvements:
* Show the comments related to a page also when viewing an older version of a page, not only in the current version.
* Extend the "Resolved comments" screen to a general comment overview showing at least: unresolved comments, resolved comments, version of adding, version of resolving.

These concepts are crucial for a decent reviewing process.
fields.summary: Improve tracking of inline comments
Formatting for Content by Label

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39261].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Confluence cannot export a page as Word file when the page contains Two Dimension Filters.
This problem occurred only in Two Dimension Filters. (not in the other JIRA Chart Macros.)
This problem occurred only when lines in JIRA Charts are more than 5.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.8.10
* JIRA 6.4.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare vanilla JIRA 6.4.11
# Prepare Confluence 5.8.10 which has Application Link to the JIRA
# Create a page
# Set a Two Dimension Filters on the page which include more than 5 assignee like the following screenshot
!show_more.png|thumbnail!
# Export the page as Word file

h3. Expected Results
The page is exported as Word file.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence shows error page like the following screenshot.

!ui_error.png|thumbnail!

Additionally, following exceptions appears on atlassian-confluence.log.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39259].
  {panel}

Any plugin in Confluence that provides a web item in the admin section gets a page header with the text of the web item on it.

This is all cool for simple plugins/pages, but is actually quite a massive pain for more complex  UIs, some examples:
* different page header than the link text
* customize the header to contain extra components

Confluence should support a param on the web-item that would allow to opt-out of the obligatory page header.
fields.summary: Ability for plugins to opt out of admin page header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39256].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

In Cloud instance, Confluence only users won't be able to view JIRA Issue Macro details added to Confluence Pages.
h3. Suggested Solution

Confluence pages will still refresh and work, but not click through to JIRA, when a user has no JIRA access. In conclusion - the macro would still pull whatever content you want it to show (display options) and be able to refresh (in realtime), but the user will not be able to click through if they don't have JIRA access.

 

Also, JSD customer who has browse project permission should have read only access on JIRA Issue Macro
fields.summary: Allow Confluence only users to have read only access on JIRA Issue Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39249].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently a SPACE admin can allow anonymous (non-registered) users view-only privileges for their space - but only if the SITE admin has "granted the global ‘Use Confluence’ permission". This works as expected - however it opens a security hole. The SPACE admin can now extend write permissions to anonymous users.
           

h3. Suggested Solution
This type of access should be in the control of the SITE admin. It would be nice for the SITE admin to have the ability to specify what anonymous permissions the SPACE admin can allow.
fields.summary: Allow system admin to have the ability to specify what anonymous permissions space administrators can grant

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39247].
  {panel}

It would be nice to be able to change the color of the search bar.

The reason of this is because I'm *color-blind* and I have problem differentiating blue tones. 
When we first installed Confluence, I was hearing everybody in my team saying that we could search pages but I never found it until someone clearly pointed out where I needed to click in order to search. 

Even now, I'm not sure where I need to click to search pages. 

I suggest that we could change the color of the "Search bar" per user so you don't have to change the full Confluence template to accommodate color-blind people and allow each user to change it if they want or make a special style for color-blind people that they can activate in their profile.
fields.summary: Give the ability to set the color of the "Search bar" per user/profile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39245].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

We have a problem with several of our Confluence pages. I have now observed problems on three different computers all using Chrome.

On certain pages, where we have a Gliffy diagram, the pages load, are shown for a second or two and then Chrome crashes. However if you open the Console (F12) and then reloads the page it does not. The same thing doesn't happen in IE.

Cheers

Martin
fields.summary: Google Chrome crash with Gliffy in Confluence pages
Confluence auto remove inactive user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39239].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Don't count {{my:favourite}} label (invisible) as 'Labels' in Contributors Summary Macro

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.8.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create any type of page
# Set *Contributors Summary Macro* on the page
# Set the page as the current user's 'Favourite'

h3. Expected Results
I don't want the macro to count {{my:favourite}} as 'Labels' like following.

||Users||Edits||Comments||Labels||
|current user|0|0|{color:red}0{color}|

h3. Actual Results
The macro counts {{my:favourite}} as 'Labels' like following.

||Users||Edits||Comments||Labels||
|current user|0|0|{color:red}1{color}|

h3. Notes
Unless {{my:favourite}} label is visible, it shouldn't be counted as 'Labels' in Contributors Summary Macro because the users might worried about the mismatch between the number on the table and sum of visible labels.
fields.summary: Don't count my:favourite label as 'Labels' in Contributors Summary Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39209].
  {panel}

Confluence shows the owner as _Unknown User (username)_ in the content owner after removing the external user from the application.

*Steps to Replicate*
1. Add a user to the LDAP that can log into Confluence. Let's call it *test1*.
2. Log in as an admin, sync the LDAP directory on Confluence so the app is aware of the user, then Log Out as admin.
3. Log in as the new user (test1).
4. Click on "Add personal space" in the Create Space screen.
5. Copy the URL of the Space home page.
6. Log out as test1.
7. Remove the user from the LDAP/group.
8. Log in as admin and perform a directory sync, make sure the user does not exist any longer.
9. Access the space created by test1 user (the url we've copied).

*Expected results*
The space/page should keep the name of the content owner, keeping their footprint.

*Current results*
We see _Unknown User (test1)_ username as owner of the space.

*Workaround*
https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=740001947
fields.summary: Unknown User (username) in the content owner after deleting user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39207].
  {panel}

As a user who meets with consistent failures to export a large Confluence space to PDF
I want to be able to
* diagnose the situation i.e. retrieve the full list of problematic pages without finding them one by one
* have a way to *exclude* all problematic pages from exported PDF automatically (and possibly have some "error report" listing them)
* possibly have all potentially problematic pages (based on information from existing JIRA tickets, for example) highlighted on the "Custom Export" screen / have number such potential problems displayed on "Export" screen to simplify life to those who don't expect problem with the content

So that i do not have to spent enormous amount of time trying to figure out the problematic pages one by one, let alone having to uncheck them in hard-to-navigate (for larger spaces with 100+ pages) checkbox-tree

Support ticket for reference: JST-151418
fields.summary: Ignore or diagnose errors / failed attempts to export the whole space as PDF
Scrollable Tables with Fixed Header in Editor
Saving modified pages over NeoOffice 3.0.2 back to the Office Connector Plugin 1.15 (Aspose Words 3.2.1) is reported to be broken
Provide an ability to change the wording on com.benryan.conversion.ConversionException of CONF-21043 fix
Office connector should handl word files with docm extension

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39199].
  {panel}

Hello,

Currently Office Connector imports the headings and automatically orders them alphabetically.

I would like to have also the option to keep the order of pages since in many cases alphabetical order do more mess than good.

Sample: we have a 1200 headings document to import. Since the Office Connector doesn't keep the initial order we have to do this manually, which is a total waste of time...
fields.summary: Office Connector should split by header either alphabetically or preserving the order of headings

Best regards,

Sebastian
fields.summary: View-File Macro (Excel): always the first sheet should be displayed, unless another sheet is definied which has to be shown first

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39197].
  {panel}

When using a newer version of Firefox, if you have installed the webdav connector add-on for Firefox and click on the link edit on office at the attachment screen, nothing happens. Additionally, if the WebDAV Launcher add-on is not installed, you are not prompted to install it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a vanilla Firefox
# Go to a Confluence page with an Office Document
# Click Edit in Office (or go to Tools - Attachments and try to edit in office from there)
#- You *should* be prompted to install the WebDAV connector at this point, according to [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Firefox+Add-On+for+the+Office+Connector], but you are not.
# Install the add-on manually
# Try to edit the document again
#- Still, nothing happens, as thought the button or link has no action attached.

h3. Workaround
This behaviour occurs because the WebDAV Launcher has not been configured. You will need to install the connector manually, then configure it following [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Firefox+Add-On+for+the+Office+Connector]. You will then be able to Edit in Office through Firefox.

h3. Hopes and Dreams
The behaviour of the WebDAV connector could be improved, to show an error or warning if the add on has not been configured. Our documentation indicates that the user will be taken to the download location if the add-on is not installed, so this should also occur.
fields.summary: Edit in office doesn't work in Firefox, if WebDAV Launcher configuration not being complete. Improve this to include a useful error for the user.
Append the import of a Word document to an existing page
Support Microsoft Office for Mac
Firefox WebDAV Launcher to be case insensitive on file extensions
Office connector should be able to import into the current page
Nora's computer
Migrate indexes (Word) to labels (Confluence)
Support Microsoft Office for Mac

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39188].
  {panel}

I have a word document with different word heading and a table of content (using the word menu insert field / TOC).
I import this word document in confluence on a page and I don't split.
The word headings become HTML headings and anchors.
The word TOC becomes a collection of lines of text.
These lines are not links to the headings/anchors and of course if you do change these headings, the changes are not reflected in this dummy TOC.

We have users for my application who are not very much macro aware.
Converting directly the word TOC to a {toc} macro would do the expected job. I have replaced the above hard coded TOC by a {toc} and I am fully satisfied.
Thanks ton consider the automatic creation of a {toc} in this scenario.

The word 2003 file is attached.
fields.summary: When importing a word document the table of content in the word document is not converted to the macro {toc}

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39187]. {panel} Hello, I'v noticed that when importing word documents, the table that office connector imports to a Confluence page uses and "class=highlight" E.g {code:HTML}{code} Is it possible to get doc import to use the correct method of tagging header cells? Header cells on the first column E.g {code:HTML} Header cell Normal cell Header cell Normal cell {code} Header on the first row E.G {code:HTML} Header cell Header cell Normal cell Normal cell {code} This would be great improvement because Scroll Office Word export uses as header row when exporting documents. And when creating a new table within Confluence the format in the first row and the first column is if they are highlighted. But when importing a word the format is with "class=highlight". Clearing all formatting and applying the header row or the header column doesn't change the HTML tags. Best regards Patrick
fields.summary: Optimization to tables in doc Import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39180].
  {panel}

*Summary*

As of now, {{viewfile}} macro does not provide an option on how to render the attachment into Confluence page. as seen on the following screenshot

!viewfile.png|thumbnail!

When rendered into a page, it can only be view into a fllscreen with no other option to change the way it rendered into the page

!view.png|thumbnail!

It would be great if options such as

* Scroll down mode view instead of page by page
* Configurable height and width
* Zoom in and out feature
* Add title
* Configurable border

*Workaround*

In order to add more parameter to render your PDF file you can use [{{wikimarkup}}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Wiki+Markup] macro on Confluence 4.x and use display image macro as describe [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF35/Displaying+an+Image] which have variety of parameters to use. For example

{code}
!UserManual.pdf|height=700,width=975,id=media!{code}
fields.summary: Provide more option to render attachment using viewfile macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39179].

When using xls file in Office Connector, there is no workbook for excel files. There should be a support for this mode.

None yet.

h3.Workaround

Unfortunately there is none.
{color:red}To be Implemented:{color}
As suggested by [Steven|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/OFFCONN-10?focusedCommentId=210032&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-210032], there should be a minor fix that warns the user that to view your tabs you should open in Excel.

*edited*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39178].
  {panel}

Hi,

we are looking forward to switch our whole process documentation for our subsidiaries from Word to Confluence. 
The already existing documentation is formatted in word with headings, so while doing the import we can choose weather to create sub-topics or not. As we often have really big manuals this makes totally sense. After importing some test manuals we noticed that unfortunately the order of the subtopics created out of the headings in word is just alphabetical! There is no way to get the old structure back. For example you have a document with three headings.

Documentname = My Thesis
TOC
1. Introduction
2. Main Part
3. End

From this results in Confluence:
A page "My thesis" with the TOC shown above
and the three children introduction, main part and end. In the side bar and the child macro those topics get shown in an alphabetical order. That means I get as list

* End
* Introduction
* Main Part

That makes navigating with the sidebar basically useless. Therefore I ideally would suggest two options:
1. Allow importing the number of the numbered heading from word to the title of the page so sorting works out automatically

2. Allow chronological sorting as kind of work around to show at least the correct order of pages
fields.summary: Allow importing of numbered headings from word while doing a split up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39172].
  {panel}

h3.Problem

Confluence CAN'T handle this kind of file inside a Word filetype.

Uploading a WMF File type will get your WMF Unrenderable.

There seems to be a problem with wmf files, they are just being ignored by their extension and are viewed as png, getting unrenderable.

Unable to render embedded object: File (test.png) not found.
Attached file was test.wmf

h3.Solution

None yet.

h3.Workaround

Don't embedded this kind of file types, for now at least.
fields.summary: wmf is viewed as png and get "Unable to render embedded object"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39163].
  {panel}

h2. Summary
When using the office connector and editing/updating a document, the page 'modified date' does not update after the change.  This is a request to update the 'modified date' of the Confluence Page when an office document is edited.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
* Log into Confluence with Firefox or Internet Explorer
* Create a new page and 'edit' it.
* Create a test Office (excel was what I used) document with test data and copy the document to the new page while in 'edit' mode.
* Save the page
* (You will need to wait a few minutes so the 'last modified date' is a few minutes previous)
* Click 'Edit Document'
* Make a change to the test office document
* Save the document

h2. Expected Result
The page 'date modified' will be updated when the office document is saved

h2. Actual Result
The page 'date modified' is unchanged after saving the office document.

h2. Environment
Windows 7
Firefox and Internet Explorer
Confluence 5.4.2 (I believe this is all versions)

h2. Other Notes
We are aware that the 'date modified' on the attachments page does get updated when a change is made.  This request is to update the Confluence page 'date modified' to reflect this information as well.
fields.summary: Update the Confluence Page Date Modified After Updating an Office Attachment
I want to put macros like  {add-label:safety}  in a Word document, import to Confluence and not have Confluence put escape \ in front of the curly brackets {

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39154].
  {panel}

When creating or editing a page in Confluence 3.5.17 in IE7, the Office Connector, (bundled version 2.0.13_backport), throws the following Java Script error:

AJS.Confluence.PropertyPanel.Macro is null or undefined

This version was released as part of the security advisory and therefore there is no further upgrade path for these customers.

*Workaround:* At this stage the only workaround is to downgrade the Office Connector to v1.18, but this is not advisable for anyone who's instance is accessible to the internet or available for public signup because this would expose the security vulnerability to any logged in user. However, this workaround would work for anyone who is using their Confluence internally and can trust their users.

Related Confluence issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26228
fields.summary: Java Script Error: "AJS.Confluence.PropertyPanel.Macro is null or undefined" in Internet Explorer 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39153].

h3.Problem

Office Connector does not Render any Objects and Plain drawings made inside Word. They are ignored by viewdoc macro.
This does not work with DOCX files.

Unfortunately there is no fix yet.

h3.Workaround

Export, or convert the object to an image file, then import to word.
or
Convert the document to DOC

There's no workaround plausible for this bug.
